verses.text: Who \add is\add* as the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add man\add*? and who \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* the \w interpretation|strong="H6592"\w* of a \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*? a \w man’s|strong="H0120"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* maketh his \w face|strong="H6440"\w* to \w shine|strong="H0215"\w*, and the \w boldness|strong="H5797"\w* of his \w face|strong="H6440"\w* shall be \w changed|strong="H8132"\w*.\f + \fr 8.1 \ft the boldness: Heb. the strength\f*

I \add counsel thee\add* to \w keep|strong="H8104"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w commandment|strong="H6310"\w*, and \add that\add* in \w regard|strong="H1700"\w* of the \w oath|strong="H7621"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

Be not \w hasty|strong="H0926"\w* to go \w out|strong="H3212"\w* of his \w sight|strong="H6440"\w*: \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* not in an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*; for he \w doeth|strong="H6213"\w* whatsoever \w pleaseth|strong="H2654"\w* him.

Where the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of a \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add is, there is\add* \w power|strong="H7983"\w*: and who may \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, What \w doest|strong="H6213"\w* thou?

Whoso \w keepeth|strong="H8104"\w* the \w commandment|strong="H4687"\w* shall \w feel|strong="H3045"\w* no \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*: and a wise \w man’s|strong="H2450"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w discerneth|strong="H3045"\w* both \w time|strong="H6256"\w* and \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*.\f + \fr 8.5 \ft shall…: Heb. shall know\f*

¶ Because to every \w purpose|strong="H2656"\w* there \w is|strong="H3426"\w* \w time|strong="H6256"\w* and \w judgment|strong="H4941"\w*, therefore the \w misery|strong="H7451"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \add is\add* \w great|strong="H7227"\w* upon him.
For he \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* not that which shall be: for who can \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* him when it shall be?\f + \fr 8.7 \ft when…: or, how it shall be?\f*

\add There is\add* no \w man|strong="H0120"\w* that hath \w power|strong="H7989"\w* over the \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* to \w retain|strong="H3607"\w* the \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*; neither \add hath he\add* \w power|strong="H7983"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of \w death|strong="H4194"\w*: and \add there is\add* no \w discharge|strong="H4917"\w* in \add that\add* \w war|strong="H4421"\w*; neither shall \w wickedness|strong="H7562"\w* \w deliver|strong="H4422"\w* those that are \w given|strong="H1167"\w* to it.\f + \fr 8.8 \ft discharge: or, casting off weapons\f*

All this have I \w seen|strong="H7200"\w*, and \w applied|strong="H5414"\w* my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* unto every \w work|strong="H4639"\w* that is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*: \add there is\add* a \w time|strong="H6256"\w* wherein one \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w ruleth|strong="H7980"\w* over another to his own \w hurt|strong="H7451"\w*.

And \w so|strong="H3651"\w* I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \w buried|strong="H6912"\w*, who had \w come|strong="H0935"\w* and \w gone|strong="H1980"\w* from the \w place|strong="H4725"\w* of the \w holy|strong="H6918"\w*, and they were \w forgotten|strong="H7911"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* where they had so \w done|strong="H6213"\w*: this \add is\add* also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.

Because \w sentence|strong="H6599"\w* against an \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w work|strong="H4639"\w* is not \w executed|strong="H6213"\w* \w speedily|strong="H4120"\w*, therefore the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w* is fully \w set|strong="H4390"\w* in them to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*.

¶ Though a \w sinner|strong="H2398"\w* \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* an hundred \w times|strong="H3967"\w*, and his \add days\add* be \w prolonged|strong="H0748"\w*, yet surely I \w know|strong="H3045"\w* that it shall be \w well|strong="H2896"\w* with them that \w fear|strong="H3373"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, which \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him:

But it shall not be \w well|strong="H2896"\w* with the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*, neither shall he \w prolong|strong="H0748"\w* \add his\add* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, \add which are\add* as a \w shadow|strong="H6738"\w*; because he \w feareth|strong="H3373"\w* not \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

There \w is|strong="H3426"\w* a \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* which is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* upon the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; that there be \w just|strong="H6662"\w* \add men\add*, unto whom it \w happeneth|strong="H5060"\w* according to the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w*; again, there \w be|strong="H3426"\w* \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \add men\add*, to whom it \w happeneth|strong="H5060"\w* according to the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w*: I \w said|strong="H0559"\w* that this \w also|strong="H1571"\w* \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.

Then I \w commended|strong="H7623"\w* \w mirth|strong="H8057"\w*, because a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* hath no better \w thing|strong="H2896"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*, than to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*, and to \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, and to be \w merry|strong="H8055"\w*: for that shall \w abide|strong="H3867"\w* with him of his \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w life|strong="H2416"\w*, which \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* him under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

¶ When I \w applied|strong="H5414"\w* mine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* to \w know|strong="H3045"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and to \w see|strong="H7200"\w* the \w business|strong="H6045"\w* that is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* upon the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*: (for also \add there is that\add* neither \w day|strong="H3117"\w* nor \w night|strong="H3915"\w* \w seeth|strong="H7200"\w* \w sleep|strong="H8142"\w* with his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*:)

Then I \w beheld|strong="H7200"\w* all the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, that a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w cannot|strong="H3201"\w* find \w out|strong="H4672"\w* the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* that is \w done|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*: \w because|strong="H0834"\w* \w though|strong="H7945"\w* a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \w labour|strong="H5998"\w* to seek \add it\add* \w out|strong="H1245"\w*, yet he shall not \w find|strong="H4672"\w* \add it;\add* yea further; though a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add man\add* \w think|strong="H0559"\w* to \w know|strong="H3045"\w* \add it\add*, yet shall he not be \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to \w find|strong="H4672"\w* \add it\add*.
